perturbation.original_text: 11. Independent Contractor. Nothing in this Development Agreement is to be construed to deem the relationship between the parties to be one  of master/servant, principal/agent, or employer/employee. To the contrary, the relationship of Cargill to Bioamber is that of independent  contractor, and Cargill will have no authority to (i) make any binding decision for, or on behalf of, Bioamber or (ii) commit Bioamber to any  contract, obligation, debt, or other liability. None of Cargill's employees will be deemed to be employees of Bioamber.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. Independent Contractor. Nothing in this Development Agreement is to be construed to deem the relationship between the parties to be one  of master/servant, principal/agent, or employer/employee. To the contrary, the relationship of Cargill to Bioamber is that of independent  contractor, and Cargill will have full authority to (i) make any binding decision for, or on behalf of, Bioamber or (ii) commit Bioamber to any  contract, obligation, debt, or other liability. Cargill's employees will be deemed to be employees of Bioamber.
perturbation.explanation: By granting Cargill, the 'independent contractor,' full authority to make binding decisions and commit Bioamber to liabilities, the modified text directly contradicts the established legal definition of an independent contractor, which typically lacks such authority. This creates ambiguity and could lead to disputes over liability and control, as well as potential misclassification under labor laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Definition of Independent Contractor; potential violations of IRS guidelines regarding independent contractor status.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 "Confidential Information" means all business, technical, and financial information related to the Work Plan, the terms and discussions  relating to the Term Sheet executed by the parties on December 3, 2009 and December 4, 2009, and to any aspect of the business of each  Party that is material to the Work Plan, including, without limitation, Licensed Tool Kit, products, product compositions, raw materials,  specifications, formulae, equipment, business plans and strategies, customer lists, supplier lists, know-how, samples, drawings, pricing  informationand other financial information, inventions, ideas, research information, packaging, manufacturing processes, and other  information, or its potential use, that is owned by or in possession of either Party. For purposes of clarity, the parties shall not disclose to  each other any Confidential Information that is not material to the Work Plan, such as, by way of example and without limitation, processes  and other information relating to post-fermentation activities. Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is in the public  domain prior to disclosure by Disclosing Party; (b) becomes part of the public domain, by publication or otherwise, through no  unauthorized act or omission by the Receiving Party; (c) is lawfully in the Receiving Party's possession prior to disclosure by the  Disclosing Party; or (d) is independently developed by an employee(s) of the Receiving Party with no access to the disclosed Confidential  Information.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 "Confidential Information" means all business, technical, and financial information, regardless of its relation to the Work Plan. This includes, without limitation, Licensed Tool Kit, products, product compositions, raw materials,  specifications, formulae, equipment, business plans and strategies, customer lists, supplier lists, know-how, samples, drawings, pricing  informationand other financial information, inventions, ideas, research information, packaging, manufacturing processes, and other  information, or its potential use, that is owned by or in possession of either Party. For purposes of clarity, the parties shall disclose to  each other any and all information, including but not limited to processes  and other information relating to post-fermentation activities. Confidential Information shall also include information that: (a) is in the public  domain prior to disclosure by Disclosing Party; (b) becomes part of the public domain, by publication or otherwise, through no  unauthorized act or omission by the Receiving Party; (c) is lawfully in the Receiving Party's possession prior to disclosure by the  Disclosing Party; or (d) is independently developed by an employee(s) of the Receiving Party with no access to the disclosed Confidential  Information.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Confidential Information' is tied to the Work Plan and excludes certain publicly available or independently developed information. The modified definition broadens this scope to include all business, technical, and financial information regardless of materiality to the Work Plan. Moreover, it reverses the exclusion to now include information already in the public domain. This creates a contradiction as publicly known information cannot legally be protected as confidential, and it makes the scope of 'Confidential Information' excessively broad and likely unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secrets Law (Uniform Trade Secrets Act); common law principles of confidentiality.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2 Improvements. Any invention or discovery relating to the Work Plan, in whole or in part, that is conceived during the term of this  Development Agreement shall be an "Improvement". The scope for Improvements will be limited to the CB1 strain itself and the [***] (the  "Field"), but shall exclude [***]. Bioamber will own any Improvement in the field of succinic acid and salts thereof and such Improvement  shall be designated "Bioamber Improvements". Cargill will own any Improvement in all fields other than the field of succinic acid and salts  thereof, subject to the rights provided in Section 5.2.1 below, and such Improvement shall be designated "Cargill Improvements". In the  event it is not clear as to ownership of any Improvement as described in this Section 5.2, in other words, if it is not clear whether an  invention or discovery is either a Bioamber Improvement or a Cargill Improvement, such Improvement shall be [***] and such Improvement  shall be designated "Joint Improvements". For purposes of clarity, as examples, Cargill Improvements are those inventions relating to  fumaric acid and malic acid. Additionally, where an Improvement has applications both in the Field and outside the Field, then such  Improvement, as it applies to the Field, shall be a Bioamber Improvement and, as it applies outside the Field, such Improvement shall be a  Cargill Improvement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2 Improvements. Any tangible or intangible creation, regardless of its relation to the Work Plan, that is created during the term of this  Development Agreement shall be an "Improvement". The scope for Improvements will not be limited to the CB1 strain itself and the [***] (the  "Field"), but shall include all fields. Bioamber will own any Improvement in any and all fields of technology and such Improvement  shall be designated "Bioamber Improvements". Cargill will not own any Improvement in any fields. In the  event it is not clear as to ownership of any Improvement as described in this Section 5.2, in other words, if it is not clear whether an  invention or discovery is either a Bioamber Improvement or a Cargill Improvement, such Improvement shall be assigned to Bioamber and such Improvement  shall be designated "Bioamber Improvements". For purposes of clarity, as examples, all Improvements are Bioamber's property. Additionally, where an Improvement has applications both in the Field and outside the Field, then all such Improvements are Bioamber's property.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Improvements' within the context of the Work Plan and assigns ownership based on the field of application, differentiating between Bioamber and Cargill Improvements. The modified text eliminates the connection to the Work Plan, broadens the definition to include any creation, and assigns all ownership of Improvements to Bioamber, regardless of the field. This directly contradicts the initial intent of shared ownership and creates an imbalance that could be challenged as unconscionable or a failure of consideration, particularly since Cargill contributed the original CB1 strain.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Patent Law (regarding inventorship and ownership); Contract Law (regarding consideration and unconscionability).
